definition: a store room for books/fig. an erudite person/the Bibliotheca and Epitome of pseudo-Apollodorus
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: It offers several advantages, such as speed and up-to-date information on a book's status.
sentences.chinese: 它有许多好处，例如在书库上加速和更新信息。

sentences.english: Dictionaries and all books in the reference stacks cannot be checked out.
sentences.chinese: 工具书和参考书书库中的所有书都不能外借。

sentences.english: By buying ten books every month, he soon accumulated a good library.
sentences.chinese: 他每月买十本书，不久便拥有了一个丰富的藏书库。

sentences.english: Most of my reading is done online or from library books.
sentences.chinese: 我大部分阅读都是从线上书库中完成的。

sentences.english: A stack is a list in which entires are removed and inserted only at the head .
sentences.chinese: 书库就是在整个名单中仅在开头被移除和插入。

sentences.english: Most libraries have open and closed stacks.
sentences.chinese: 多数图书馆有开架和闭架两种书库。

sentences.english: This electronic library contains a great number of ancient Chinese books.
sentences.chinese: 这个电子书库收录了大量的中国古代典籍。

sentences.english: One book that’s not in my library is What Color is Your Parachute?
sentences.chinese: 我的书库中缺少的一本是《你的降落伞是什么颜色？

definition: teashop with performance by 評書|评书 story tellers/(attached to name of publishing houses)/(in former times) private school/library (of classic texts)
books (in a library or bookstore)/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]
home page (of a website)/title page/front page/first page/fig. beginning/cover letter
treasure-house/treasury/treasure-trove (often fig., book of treasured wisdom)
